page.title: 12Birdham, Westlands Farm
page.content: Westlands Farm is typical of farms in the area. It has 130 acres of land ranging from second to fourth grade (near the sea). There are three houses, one which is occupied by the farmer and his family and the other two by families who have nothing to do with farming. There are no farm labourers. Work is contracted out to specialists. 100 acres are under the plough and grow wheat only. The variety used is Avalon, short stemmed wheat for grinding into bread flour. Each acre yields between 2 and 3.5 tons of grain. Ploughing and harvesting are done by specialist firms. The rest of the farm is for raising steers and sheep, for lambs and wool, and poultry for eggs which are sold at the farm.
